job description:
Summary: Provides support and coordination for credentialing software and database management. Works with Information

Services (I/S) and vendor to continually develop, troubleshoot, upgrade and maintain technology. Serves as lead

technical resource, facilitates training and enhancements to improve efficiencies and maximize utilization of

practitioner database. Develops standardized data conventions and performs system audits to ensure ongoing

compliance and effectiveness. Is responsible for report writing as requested by leadership and other system

departments.

Education: Associates Degree or knowledge and skills gained in administration information systems or health care related field to be comparably qualified.

Certification: Certification by National Association Medical Staff Services as Certified Provider Credentialing Specialist or Certified Professional Medical Staff Management is preferred but not required.

Experience: Minimum of 3 years experience in a health care setting or office administration preferably information technology and database performance. Knowledge and experience in Microsoft Office and accurate keyboard skills. Good verbal and written communication skills attention to detail and ability to work independently using critical thinking skills.
